project_abstract.cdata: The objectives of the Emergency District Heating Reconstruction Project are to: 1) restore district heating service in Sarajevo as soon as possible by reconstructing both the district heat supply system as well as by reconstructing building internal heating installations; 2) enable Bosnia and Herzegovina to potentially reduce its gas consumption through fuel switching by Toplane-Sarajevo from gas to fuel oil, which will enhance the country's strategically important security of energy supply; 3) strengthen Toplane-Sarajevo's institutional capacity; and 4) initiate network improvements. The project will enhance energy efficiency and energy conservation and reduce environmental pollution by enabling disconnection of about 34,000 flats in Sarajevo from self-made gas connections. The project consists of the following major components: 1) a technical assistance component, especially needed for: (a) project management; (b) engineering; (c) financial and commercial management; and (d) system planning; and 2) a reconstruction component which includes: (a) boilers; (b) distribution network; (c) substations; (d) remote control center; (e) internal building installations; and (f) metering. In Sarajevo, the major components will be: 1) technical assistance which will be used for project management, including an engineering survey and assessment, and for staff training, master plan and tariff studies; and 2) investments for the reconstruction all of parts of the district heating network, including building internals. In Banja Luka, technical assitance will be used for project preparation (engineering survey and assessment) only.
